quotes.quote: Birth is not only about making babies. It's about making mothers~ strong, competent, capable mothers who trust themselves and believe in their inner strength.
Birth is the sudden opening of a window, through which you look out upon a stupendous prospect. For what has happened? A miracle. You have exchanged nothing for the possibility of everything.
Childbirth is more admirable than conquest, more amazing than self-defense, and as courageous as either one.
The Knowledge of how to give birth without outside interventions lies deep within each woman.
Man's main task in life is to give birth to himself, to become what he potentially is. The most important product of his effort is his own personality.
Good birth is a fine thing, but the merit is our ancestors.
Birth is a shipwreck, the mewling infant shored on unknown land.
The birth of all things is weak and tender; and therefore we should have our eyes intent on beginnings.
As the births of living creatures at first are ill-shapen, so are all innovations, which are the births of time.
The so-called miracle of birth is nature getting her own way.
What is birth to a man if it shall be a stain to his dead ancestors to have left such an offspring?
How you approach birth is intimately connected with how you approach life.
Birth is as safe as life gets.
Birth isn't something we suffer, but something we actively do and exult in.
Prevention of birth is a precipitation of murder.
Birth is a beautiful thing.
Birth is the doorway for integration of body and mind.

Birth is an opportunity to transcend. To rise above what we are accustomed to, reach deeper inside ourselves than we are familiar with, and to see not only what we are truly made of, but the strength we can access in and through birth.
Birth is a rite of passage of women. Their journey should be honored, their rights should be fiercely protected, and their stories should be shared.
Birth is a three legged stool, a healthy mom, a healthy baby and a healthy birth. Without ANY one leg, it is equally unstable!
birth is the pinnacle where women discover the courage to become mothers
Birth is about radical, creative, life-affirming change. It is about adaptation on a nearly unbelievable scale.
Birth is a mystery. Words are not enough.
Birth matters. It brings us into being, on many levels.
Birth is the epicenter of women's power.
Birth may be a matter of a moment, but it is a unique one.
Our birth is but a sleep and a forgetting. Not in entire forgetfulness, and not in utter nakedness, but trailing clouds of glory do we come.
Birth: The first and direst of all disasters.
In giving birth to our babies, we may find that we give birth to new possibilities within ourselves.
Birth is not an emergency. It is simply an emergence.
Giving birth is little more than a set of muscular contractions granting passage of a child. Then the mother is born.
The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
The birth of a child is a joy to the parent and the world.
The birth of a child is divine miracle.
The day of birth is a sacred day.
To celebrate the birth of new life, is to appreciate the miraculous work of the Creator.
Giving birth should be your greatest achievement not your greatest fear.

Attending births is like growing roses. You have to marvel at the ones that just open up and bloom at the first kiss of the sun but you wouldn't dream of pulling open the petals of the tightly closed buds and forcing them to blossom to your time line.
We have a secret in our culture, it's not that birth is painful, it's that women are strong.
Birthing is the most profound initiation to spirituality a woman can have.
Birth is an experience that demonstrates that life is not merely function and utility, but form and beauty.
We are born, so to speak, twice over; born into existence, and born into life; born a human being, and born a man.
A man may be born, but in order to be born he must first die, and in order to die he must first awake.
Husbands don't really count ... in the miracle of birth.
As the births of living creatures at first are ill-shapen, so are all innovations, which are the births of time.
And thou shalt have joy and gladness; and many shall rejoice at his birth.
We know that birth takes a woman from one place in her life to another. The birth of a child certainly does change her viewpoint of herself and I believe her viewpoint of the world.
